name: Residence Inn New Orleans Covington/North Shore

reviews.title: My new favorite
reviews.text: The location was far from traffic noise, close to the nicest restaurants. The king suite was super clean, stylish and loaded with amenities, true hd channels, granite, wood, stocked kitchen. The breakfast eggs tasted like eggs, unlike many hotel chains. The breakfast had plenty of choices in a unique mod dining area. I generally use Holiday express and Comfort suites, which I really like, but this is a notch up. I'll be back.

reviews.title: Solid Residence Inn
reviews.text: This is exactly what you expect from a Residence Inn. The room was very clean with plenty of room to spread out. The hotel can be a little difficult to find as it is off the road and behind an office park. This does mean it is quiet. There are plenty of food options within walking and easy driving distance. The breakfast buffet was very tasty. Check in was quick and easy. All and all a nice hotel.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in quiet location!
reviews.text: Decided to stay here because we love Residence Inn hotels. This was was by far the best we've ever stayed in! I'm not sure how new this hotel is but it looked brand new and it was very clean! Full breakfast was once again a hit for our family of 4! In a quiet location but close to restaurants! Stayed here for a night before we left for our cruise the following day. It was about an hour drive to the Port of New Orleans. Definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again!

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a mini "get away" and we enjoyed it. It was very peaceful. The rooms were nice and clean. Shopping and restaurants are less than a mile away. Would definitely stay here again. Great hotel.

reviews.title: Clean and quiet
reviews.text: We stayed two nights at the Residence Inn in Covington while visiting with family. It was spacious, clean, quiet and very comfortable. It is a huge improvement over the other area hotels. Being well off the busy Covington roads is a huge plus. Excellent restaurants are available nearby. Our choice was based on tripadvisor reviews, and they were right.

reviews.title: Comfortable, Friendly, Convenient
reviews.text: This hotel is a perfect example of its class. The suite was very clean and well-furnished. The staff was very helpful in keeping a delivery for my wife for our arrival (it beat us there by about an hour). It exceeded anything I could expect for a hotel in this price range. Can't miss!

reviews.title: Surprisingly great hotel while on road trip.
reviews.text: This hotel had modern spacious rooms. The service was fantastic. The free breakfast was great, consisting of tons of hot and cold items. No complaints, great stop!

reviews.title: Immaculate Hotel
reviews.text: We stayed here over the weekend. This hotel is SUPER clean. The bathroom had Daves Gate amenities, the suite was very clean. The sofa, the beds, the kitchen.... All very nicely done. I was very impressed with the hotel. Situated down a residential/corporate office area. Well kept grounds and quiet yet safe area off the beaten path. Minutes from shopping.

reviews.title: Best place in Mandeville/Covington area. Hands down.
reviews.text: Breakfast was more than we could have ever eaten. Fresh homemade waffle station, hot oatmeal and fresh fruit, granola, nuts, variety of juices, coffee, and eggs and sausage as well.

reviews.title: Everything I needed, and then some.
reviews.text: We stayed at the Marriot courtyard nearby. When we tried to extend our stay. They said they were booked. One call to the Residents Inn. And everything was takin care of. (And the room turned out to be 10 times nicer than the Marriot Courtyard!!) Found my place to stay when in Mandeville.

reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.text: Though the front desk reception was a little "stand-offish" the one bedroom suite was in excellent shape, clean, and well maintained.

reviews.title: The best!
reviews.text: This is one of the better properties on the Northshore.
